recipe.ingredients: - green lentils: 1 cup - water: 3 cups - carrots (diced): 2 medium - celery stalks (diced): 2 - onion (diced): 1 large - garlic cloves (minced): 2 - tomatoes (diced, canned, no-salt-added): 1 can (14.5 ounces) - spinach (chopped): 2 cups - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - dried thyme: 1 teaspoon - dried rosemary: 1 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Cook Lentils: Rinse the lentils under cold water. In a large pot, bring 3 cups of water to a boil. Add lentils, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until lentils are tender. 2. Sauté Vegetables: In another pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add onions, carrots, and celery, and sauté until the onions are translucent. Add garlic and sauté for another minute. 3. Combine and Simmer: Add the cooked lentils (with their cooking liquid), sautéed vegetables, canned tomatoes, thyme, and rosemary to a large pot. Stir well to combine. Simmer for about 15 minutes on low heat. 4. Add Spinach: Stir in chopped spinach and cook for an additional 5 minutes, or until spinach is wilted. 5. Season and Serve: Season the stew with black pepper. Serve hot.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 40g, Dietary Fiber: 18g, Sodium: 70mg, Saturated Fat: 0.5g, Total Fat: 3g, Protein: 15g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 4g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 493 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Green Lentils: 230 calories for 1 cup cooked Carrots: 50 calories for 2 medium Celery Stalks: 12 calories for 2 Onion: 45 calories for 1 large Garlic: 9 calories for 2 cloves Tomatoes (No salt added): 32 calories per can Spinach: 14 calories Olive Oil: 120 calories for 1 tablespoon Thyme, Rosemary, Black Pepper: Negligible - Serving People: 4
